page.title: 02OLANDS
page.content: Olands house itself is a 19th century building with beautiful plaster ceilings covered with roses.It has a big kitchen,sitting and dining rooms.The house has many bedrooms and a snooker room.The grounds are also very big.Vegetables are grown behind the house and the front garden is lawn where the children ride their bikes and play cricket.The children at Olands live away from their parents for a while because of family problems or arguements.It is called an assessment centre and is run by the social services.The children go to schools in Taunton and Wiveliscombe. Every summer they hold a dog show and garden fete,when the house and grounds are open to the public.
